ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Only if you really are interested in learning the program, and already having some idea of a project would be interested in pursuing...

Take this class if you'd like to be able to do geographic analysis in your field--neat projects this year included projecting best sites for wind power availability in Kenya, affordable housing according to census data, and the ideal route for high-speed rail. Learning the program is a little tedious at times, but Professor Tomlin is extremely helpful.

YES! GIS was unlike any class Ive taken at Yale  and it was awesome. I was worried about taking the class because course evaluations in previous years mentioned that the software was overwhelmingly time consuming. This is just not true. As soon as you get stuck for more than a minute, shoot Professor Tomlin an email and hell get back to you within an hour, if not right away. The trick is to not start your assignments the night before theyre due, but if you can do that, the work is totally manageable. The time I spent working in the program was relaxing, creative and ultimately produced results that Im proud of. Ultimately, if you like maps, youll love this class.
I would recommend this class if you are willing to take on an independent project geared toward learning ArcGIS, a very helpful program.
Yes, I would absolutely recommend it to anyone who may be interested in learning the software. I thought Professor Tomlin was great, and I'm really pleased with my final project.
